function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Globalization and sustained economic growth, as foundational assumptions of the SDGs, are hampered by COVID-19, leading to slow progress.","Impact":"Failure to achieve 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by 2030 and potential counterproductive outcomes due to pandemic impacts.","Mitigation":"Adaptation of SDGs to be more resilient to shocks imposed by pandemics, and strategies to mitigate pandemic impacts on the SDGs.","Technologies":"Data analytics for tracking and monitoring pandemic impacts on SDGs, and digital communication tools for remote collaboration on SDG adaptation.","People":"All countries committed to the SDGs, especially those experiencing pandemic impacts.","Owner":"United Nations and global health organizations."},{"Description":"Reductions in air pollution due to COVID-19-induced lockdowns and decreased industrial activities.","Impact":"Positive improvements in air quality globally, demonstrating potential for environmental and health benefits.","Mitigation":"Developing sustainable policies and regulations to maintain improved air quality post-pandemic, and promoting alternative energy sources to reduce reliance on polluting activities.","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring systems, renewable energy technologies, and public health data tracking tools.","People":"Global population, especially those affected by air pollution.","Owner":"Environmental agencies, governments, and international health organizations."}]}
